document_data.name: Mountain of Skulls
document_data.mainbody: The '''Mountain of Skulls''' was a temple of [[Cyric]] found within the [[Cloud Peaks]] of [[Amn]] ''circa'' the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Location: The temple was built within a nearly inaccessible cavern, {{SI|1|mi|k|long=yes}} into a gaping gorge, some {{SI|10|mi|k|long=yes}} east of [[the Fangs]].
document_data.Structure: A skull-shaped opening formed the cave in which the temple was founded.
document_data.Interior: The Mountain of Skulls earned its name from the massive mound of skulls that lay within its center. This horrific display was treated as an idol by the local Cyricists.
document_data.Activities: The temple was overseen by Watchful Skull [[Tynnos Argrim]], founder of the order of [[assassin]]s known as the [[Flames of the Dark Sun]].
document_data.History:
The temple was once dedicated to the god [[Bane]], before being claimed by Cyricists during the [[Banedeath#Legacy|Amnian Banedeath]] in the {{YearlinkName|1362}}.

In the summer of the {{YearlinkName|1369}}, Watchful Skull Argrim slew the leader of the [[Dark Redoubt]] within the temple's premises and forced its clergy to fall under his own leadership.

The Mountain of Skulls endured the decades of languish experienced by the Cyricist faith, and remained standing as of the {{YearlinkName|1479}}.
